ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Further cemented unarmed combat skills and learned sword fighting. We also delved into rope work, theatrical firearms, and theatrical violence on film.
I learned how to perform violence theatrically, specifically with prop weapons. I learned how to create a safe space with the people in the class and who I was worked with.
Learned a lot of stage combat! Different methods, thoughts on acting, and felt relly challenged and supported by the professors.
Basic knowledge of armed stage combat, initial experience putting theatrical violence on film
theatrical sword fighting, falling, firearms, ropes, and how to approach staged violence from the perspective of film

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Really fun, you get to learn cool skills, lots of freedom, assignments never felt like work, and Mike and Kelsey are both incredible. Weaknesses: Not really any, but for the final project, it would have been nice to see examples of the documents we were expected to create.
I absolutely loved every minute of this class, the professors are so wonderful and well run. I would have enjoyed more time to learn about theatrical violence in film.
As we discussed on the last day, some more example materials for the final might be helpful, but other than that the course is great.
I think it would be helpful if this class were slightly shorter! 2 hours was sometimes tough to stay focused all the way through for such a highly physical class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!! If you are able to take this class, please do so. Not only did I grow as a theatermaker and learn applicable skills, but I was pushed out of my comfort zone and encouraged to take risks. This class was a space where I didn't feel like I had to be a Yale Student or a Theater Person, and I could just exist as a person and be motivated simply by wanting to get better at the moves that we were learning. Also sword fighting is really fun.
YES. Take this class. You will not regret it. The vibes are amazing and the skills you learn are so interesting and fun.
YES! Mike and Kelsey are the best profs on this campus and they are so kind. This is an amazing yale class-- take it.

Absolutely. This course is fun and not too challenging to fit into a schedule while also being extremely practical. I've developed as much practical skill from this course (and the intro version) as from any other course in this theatre major.
this course is such a blast. would definitely recommend!
